column4: None of my apps will go fullscreen. Whenever I try to make vlc or totem or whatever go fullscreen, it appears in a window that extends only to the edge of my panel. and it has window borders and everything
Any idea why that might be?
do you have XVideo extension in your xorg.conf
Should it be enabled or disabled?
Should I turn Xvideo on or off?
it should be loaded
ill check
its not loaded
under modules just put Load "Xvideo" ?
you could also try changing the output device for vlc
its still not working. loaded xvideo and set vlc to use it
are you running beryl or something lame like that?
nope. im using fglrx but no beryl or xgl. and it always worked before
I don't get it. Fullscreen always worked before. I'm not using Xgl now for sure.
try rm ~/.vlc
yes but this happens in totem too
what changes did you make, if any, before this problem occured?
none that i know of!
hey totem works now that i set it back to totem-gstreamer instead of totem-xine.
but vlc doesnt work still
try deleting the ~/.vlc
did that
I got it.
Default option was to let the windowmanager handle fullscreening. Disabled that and let vlc handle it. works fine now
